avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: The patchy snow cover will remain firm and stable in all locations. Greatest snow cover will be mostly in mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges and on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 750 metres. Snow will be mainly confined to coire rims, ridge flanks and gullies. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: TO 16/2. Dry with strong E or SE winds decreasing. Patchy snow cover will be firm and stable. Low Hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: It will be dry and cloudy throughout the period. Strong Easterly or South-Easterly winds will steadily decrease through the day becoming fresh to moderate. The overnight freezing level will be around 400 metres, rising to around 600 metres during the day.
Observed Weather Influences: A dry and bright day, sunny at times, cloudier in the afternoon. Light to moderate East-South-Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: The patchy snow cover is firm and stable in all locations. Greatest snow cover is mostly in mountain areas inland from the coastal ranges and on Northerly to Easterly aspects above 750 metres. Snow is mainly confined to coire rims, ridge flanks and gullies. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Unstable windslab will continue to develop on West through North to North-East aspects above 900 metres. Areas affected will be steep locations such as gullies, crag aprons and corrie rims. Below 900 metres and above 700 metres, these accumulations will be more isolated, affecting steep banks and burn lines. Fragile cornices will overhang some of these aspects. Elsewhere the snowpack will be firm and stable. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 16.2: Unstable windslab on W, NW,N, NE aspects above 900m, isolated on steep banks below. Fragile cornices. Moderate Hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: Fresh South-East winds will increase strong to gale force during the day and become South-South-Easterly in direction. Very little precipitation expected apart from a trace of snow during the morning.  The freezing level will be around 600 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: Snowfall during the early morning cleared to leave a dry day. Drifting snow on fresh South-Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 700 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Accumulations of unstable windslab continue to develop on West to North aspects above 900 metres, older windslab instabilities remain on North-East aspects. The greatest instability is within steep and convex wind sheltered locations such as corrie rims, gullies and crag aprons. Fragile cornices overhang some of these aspects.  Elsewhere the old snowpack is firm and stable and plateau areas mostly scoured.  The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Good stability in most locations. Redistribution of snow may add new weak windslab on to steep West to North aspects above 950 metres, though this is expected to be confined to coire rims and gully exits. Minor pre-existing cold induced instabilities will remain on selected steep North to East aspects above 1000 metres.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Low hazard. Localised instability. New weak windslab possible on W to N aspects above 950m.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: No precipitation is forecast. Remaining cold. Moderate to strong East-South-East later South-East winds.
Observed Weather Influences: Cold with light overnight snow showers which extended into the morning. Light to moderate East-South-East winds throughout.
ObservedSnowStability: Stability is good in most locations. Some localised near surface instabilities persist in older snow mainly on North to East aspects above 1000 metres. Also, new thin weakly bonded windslab on steep West to North aspects above 950 metres: Build up here not yet extensive and confined to coire rims and gully tops. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Little change is expected in the snowpack. Some unstable but shallow, isolated and generally avoidable deposits of windslab will remain on mainly West to North aspects above 900 metres. Otherwise the snowpack will be shallow and generally stable. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: LO for 16/2. Some shallow and isolated deposits of windslab on mainly W to N aspects above 900m. Otherwise generally stable. Low haz

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: A cloudy but dry day with near gale South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will be around 600 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: After some light overnight snow at all levels it was a generally dry but cloudy day. Winds were from the South-East. The freezing level rose to around 700 metres through the day.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is generally shallow and well bonded. Some localised deposits of windslab had formed overnight and were present on West through to North aspects above 900 metres. However, these tended to be isolated, shallow and  avoidable. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Windslab will continue to develop in wind sheltered locations on West to North aspects above 900 metres. Sharply defined corrie rims, gully tops and steep burn lines will be most affected. Fragile cornices will continue to develop. Most areas will continue to hold shallow snow or well bonded snow-ice.  The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SC 16/02/25 Moderately bonded windslab in steeper wind sheltered locations on W to N aspects above 900m. Cornices! Av Haz Moderate.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: A trace of snow overnight above 500 metres with some light to moderate snowfall during the day. Strong Easterly winds overnight, veering South-South-Easterly during the afternoon. Freezing level around 600 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: A cold day with fresh Easterly winds. A trace of new snow above 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Moderately bonded windslab is present in steeper, wind sheltered locations on West to North aspects above 900 metres with localised pockets on some North-East aspects. Elsewhere the snow is either very shallow or well frozen stable old snow. Some small cornices present above these aspects. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Snowpack stability will remain good. Greatest accumulations will remain on North to East aspects above 800 metres. The avalanche hazard will be Low.
avalancheActivity.highlights: GC for 16/2/25. Snowpack stability will remain good. Greatest accumulations will remain on N-E aspects above 800m. Low hazard.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: It will remain dry with strong East-South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will be around 700 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: It was a dry day with moderate South-Easterly winds. The freezing level rose to around 600 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: Snowpack stability is generally good. The few, isolated, shallow deposits of windslab that persist on high North to East aspects are well bonded. A breakable crust exists in many locations, with the snow surface firm and icy in other locations. The avalanche hazard is Low.
